content_blocks.section: How do you predict ICU bed occupancy and optimize resources at critical times, such as a pandemic?

content_blocks.text: With the aim of analyzing and predicting the dynamics of COVID-19, especially the occupation of ICU beds in different epidemic waves, the study led by ProfessorHenrique Paiva,in partnership with the Federal University of SÃ£o Paulo (UNIFESP) and published in the journalMathematical Modelling of Natural Phenomena, proposed a phenomenological model using data from five Italian regions.
content_blocks.section: How do you predict ICU bed occupancy and optimize resources at critical times, such as a pandemic?

content_blocks.text: The aim was tosupport decision-making by health authorities and hospital administrators, enabling more efficient management of resources and containment measures.
content_blocks.section: How do you predict ICU bed occupancy and optimize resources at critical times, such as a pandemic?

content_blocks.text: The results were highly effective: the model fitted the historical data very well, with an average relative RMSE of 0.51% for the fit and 0.93% for the forecasts. This accuracy was essential for anticipating the demand for beds and helping to reduce mortality rates.
content_blocks.section: How do you predict ICU bed occupancy and optimize resources at critical times, such as a pandemic?

content_blocks.text: In addition to the COVID-19 pandemic, the study highlights that the model can be adapted to other regions and diseases, due to its low cost and optimization efficiency.
content_blocks.section: How do you predict ICU bed occupancy and optimize resources at critical times, such as a pandemic?

content_blocks.text: It is a valuable tool for the planning and allocation of medical resources in future epidemics, strengthening the response capacity in emergency situations.Access the full articlehere.
